intro: Trisyngyne bernhardii, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, adapting well to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain several seeds. Trisyngyne bernhardii is valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators and its resilience in harsh conditions.
